ajax.class.php

00001 <?php
00002 /**
00003  * Main ajax class for Osimo that all other
00004  * ajax classes extend.
00005  *
00006  * @brief Main ajax class for Osimo.
00007  * @author Ryan LeFevre
00008  */
00009  
00010 class OsimoAjax {
00011  protected $triggers;
00012 
00013  /**
00014   * Class constructor
00015   */
00016  function OsimoAjax() {
00017   $this->triggers = array();
00018   get('osimo')->ajax_mode = true;
00019  }
00020 
00021  /**
00022   * Used to register all the ajax triggers for the
00023   * current ajax class. A trigger is a variable
00024   * set in Javascript and set over ajax so that PHP
00025   * knows what function to execute to handle the incoming
00026   * ajax data. All incoming POST variables are pulled into
00027   * Osimo's class scope.
00028   *
00029   * @param Array $triggers
00030   */
00031  protected function register($triggers) {
00032   if (is_array($triggers)) {
00033    $this->triggers = $triggers;
00034 
00035    if (isset($_POST['ajax_trigger']) && isset($triggers[$_POST['ajax_trigger']])) {
00036     $this->run_trigger($triggers[$_POST['ajax_trigger']]);
00037    }
00038   }
00039  }
00040 
00041  private function run_trigger($func) {
00042   foreach ($_POST as $var=>$POST) {
00043    get('osimo')->requirePOST($var, false, false);
00044   }
00045 
00046   $this->$func();
00047  }
00048 
00049  /**
00050   * Simple function that echoes data in json format
00051   * and halts script execution.
00052   *
00053   * @param mixed $data
00054   */
00055  protected function json_return($data) {
00056   if (is_array($data)) {
00057    echo json_encode($data);
00058   }
00059   else {
00060    echo json_encode(array("data"=>$data));
00061   }
00062 
00063   exit;
00064  }
00065 
00066  /**
00067   * Similar to json_return except the default
00068   * index for an error is "error" instead of "data".
00069   * This function also halts script execution.
00070   *
00071   * @param mixed $data
00072   */
00073  protected function json_error($data) {
00074   if (is_array($data)) {
00075    echo json_encode($data);
00076   }
00077   else {
00078    echo json_encode(array("error"=>$data));
00079   }
00080 
00081   exit;
00082  }
00083 
00084 
00085 }
00086 
00087 
00088 ?>
